cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi (45 km) SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Meandering near the Yucatan Channel through early Monday, then accelerating north-to-north-northeast over the eastern Gulf of Mexico, aiming for the Florida Big Bend before sweeping northeast across GA/SC and exiting off the NC coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Yucatan Peninsula; Isle of Youth, Cuba (watch only – not affecting NC)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Yucatan Peninsula Tulum to Rio Lagartos including Cozumel; Pinar del Rio, Cuba (warning only – not affecting NC)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, Florida Panhandle, Georgia coast, South Carolina coast, and portions of the North Carolina coast (including Cape Fear region)
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions likely late Thu into Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding or 1–2 ft surge possible along the lower Cape Fear River if onshore flow develops
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 2–4 in, locally higher >4 in, beginning late Wed and continuing through Thu
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible brief coastal flooding at high tide
